breadcrumbs: 6A003 Cameras, systems or equipment, and “components” therefor, as follows (see List of Items Controlled).
Imaging cameras incorporating “focal plane arrays” having any of the following:
history.text: Incorporating “focal plane arrays” controlled by 6A002.a.3.f; or

structure.heading: Incorporating “focal plane arrays” controlled by 6A002.a.3.f; or
structure.label: 6A003.b.4.b – Incorporating “focal plane arrays” controlled by 6A002.a.3.f; or

history.heading: Note 3: 6A003.b.4.b does not control imaging cameras having any of the following characteristics: a. A maximum frame rate equal to or less than 9 Hz; b. Having all of the following: 1. Having a minimum horizontal or vertical ‘ Instantaneous-Field-of-View (IFOV)’ of at least 10 mrad/pixel (milliradians/pixel); 2. Incorporating a fixed focal-length lens that is not designed to be removed; 3. Not incorporating a ‘ direct view’ display; and
history.title: Note 3: 6A003.b.4.b does not control imaging cameras having any of the following characteristics: a. A maximum frame rate equal to or less than 9 Hz; b. Having all of the following: 1. Having a minimum horizontal or vertical ‘ Instantaneous-Field-of-View (IFOV)’ of at least 10 mrad/pixel (milliradians/pixel); 2. Incorporating a fixed focal-length lens that is not designed to be removed; 3. Not incorporating a ‘ direct view’ display; and

supplement.heading: Supplement No. 6 to Part 774 - Sensitive List

history.text:
Note 3: 6A003.b.4.b does not control imaging cameras having any of the following characteristics: a. A maximum frame rate equal to or less than 9 Hz; b. Having all of the following: 1. Having a minimum horizontal or vertical ‘ Instantaneous-Field-of-View (IFOV)’ of at least 10 mrad/pixel (milliradians/pixel); 2. Incorporating a fixed focal-length lens that is not designed to be removed; 3. Not incorporating a ‘ direct view’ display; and
Technical Note: ‘ Direct view’ refers to an imaging camera operating in the infrared spectrum that presents a visual image to a human observer using a near-to-eye micro display incorporating any light-security mechanism. 4. Having any of the following: a. No facility to obtain a viewable image of the detected field-of-view; or b. The camera is designed for a single kind of application and designed not to be user modified; or
Technical Note: ‘ Instantaneous Field of View (IFOV)’ specified in Note 3.b is the lesser figure of the ‘ Horizontal FOV’ or the ‘ Vertical FOV’. ‘ Horizontal IFOV’ = horizontal Field of View (FOV)/number of horizontal detector elements ‘ Vertical IFOV’= vertical Field of View (FOV)/number of vertical detector elements. c. Where the camera is “specially designed” for installation into a civilian passenger land vehicle of less than 3 tonnes three tons (gross vehicle weight) and having all of the following: 1. Is operable only when installed in any of the following: a. The civilian passenger land vehicle for which it was intended; or b. A “specially designed”, authorized maintenance test facility; and 2. Incorporates an active mechanism that forces the camera not to function when it is removed from the vehicle for which it was intended.

structure.heading: Note 3: 6A003.b.4.b does not control imaging cameras having any of the following characteristics: a. A maximum frame rate equal to or less than 9 Hz; b. Having all of the following: 1. Having a minimum horizontal or vertical ‘ Instantaneous-Field-of-View (IFOV)’ of at least 10 mrad/pixel (milliradians/pixel); 2. Incorporating a fixed focal-length lens that is not designed to be removed; 3. Not incorporating a ‘ direct view’ display; and
structure.label: 6A003.b.4.b – Note 3: 6A003.b.4.b does not control imaging cameras having any of the following characteristics: a. A maximum frame rate equal to or less than 9 Hz; b. Having all of the following: 1. Having a minimum horizontal or vertical ‘ Instantaneous-Field-of-View (IFOV)’ of at least 10 mrad/pixel (milliradians/pixel); 2. Incorporating a fixed focal-length lens that is not designed to be removed; 3. Not incorporating a ‘ direct view’ display; and

content.html:
Technical Note:

‘ Direct view’ refers to an imaging camera operating in the infrared spectrum that presents a visual image to a human observer using a near-to-eye micro display incorporating any light-security mechanism.

4. Having any of the following:

a. No facility to obtain a viewable image of the detected field-of-view; or

b. The camera is designed for a single kind of application and designed not to be user modified; or
content.text: Technical Note: ‘ Direct view’ refers to an imaging camera operating in the infrared spectrum that presents a visual image to a human observer using a near-to-eye micro display incorporating any light-security mechanism. 4. Having any of the following: a. No facility to obtain a viewable image of the detected field-of-view; or b. The camera is designed for a single kind of application and designed not to be user modified; or

content.html:
Technical Note:

‘ Instantaneous Field of View (IFOV)’ specified in Note 3.b is the lesser figure of the ‘ Horizontal FOV’ or the ‘ Vertical FOV’.

‘ Horizontal IFOV’ = horizontal Field of View (FOV)/number of horizontal detector elements

‘ Vertical IFOV’= vertical Field of View (FOV)/number of vertical detector elements.

c. Where the camera is “specially designed” for installation into a civilian passenger land vehicle of less than 3 tonnes three tons (gross vehicle weight) and having all of the following:

1. Is operable only when installed in any of the following:

a. The civilian passenger land vehicle for which it was intended; or

b. A “specially designed”, authorized maintenance test facility; and

2. Incorporates an active mechanism that forces the camera not to function when it is removed from the vehicle for which it was intended.
content.text: Technical Note: ‘ Instantaneous Field of View (IFOV)’ specified in Note 3.b is the lesser figure of the ‘ Horizontal FOV’ or the ‘ Vertical FOV’. ‘ Horizontal IFOV’ = horizontal Field of View (FOV)/number of horizontal detector elements ‘ Vertical IFOV’= vertical Field of View (FOV)/number of vertical detector elements. c. Where the camera is “specially designed” for installation into a civilian passenger land vehicle of less than 3 tonnes three tons (gross vehicle weight) and having all of the following: 1. Is operable only when installed in any of the following: a. The civilian passenger land vehicle for which it was intended; or b. A “specially designed”, authorized maintenance test facility; and 2. Incorporates an active mechanism that forces the camera not to function when it is removed from the vehicle for which it was intended.

Incorporating a fixed focal-length lens that is not designed to be removed; 3. Not incorporating a ‘ direct view’ display; and
structure.label: 6A003.b.4.b – Note 3: 6A003.b.4.b does not control imaging cameras having any of the following characteristics: a. A maximum frame rate equal to or less than 9 Hz; b. Incorporating a fixed focal-length lens that is not designed to be removed; 3. Not incorporating a ‘ direct view’ display; and

content.html:
Technical Note:

‘ Direct view’ refers to an imaging camera operating in the infrared spectrum that presents a visual image to a human observer using a near-to-eye micro display incorporating any light-security mechanism.

4. Having any of the following:

a. No facility to obtain a viewable image of the detected field-of-view; or

b. The camera is designed for a single kind of application and designed not to be user modified; or
content.text: Technical Note: ‘ Direct view’ refers to an imaging camera operating in the infrared spectrum that presents a visual image to a human observer using a near-to-eye micro display incorporating any light-security mechanism. 4. Technical Note:

‘ Instantaneous Field of View (IFOV)’ specified in Note 3.b is the lesser figure of the ‘ Horizontal FOV’ or the ‘ Vertical FOV’.

‘ Horizontal IFOV’ = horizontal Field of View (FOV)/number of horizontal detector elements

‘ Vertical IFOV’= vertical Field of View (FOV)/number of vertical detector elements.

c. Where the camera is “specially designed” for installation into a civilian passenger land vehicle of less than 3 tonnes three tons (gross vehicle weight) and having all of the following:

1. Is operable only when installed in any of the following:

a. The civilian passenger land vehicle for which it was intended; or

b. A “specially designed”, authorized maintenance test facility; and

2. Incorporates an active mechanism that forces the camera not to function when it is removed from the vehicle for which it was intended.

history.text:
Note 3: 6A003.b.4.b does not control imaging cameras having any of the following characteristics: a. A maximum frame rate equal to or less than 9 Hz; b. Having all of the following: 1. Having a minimum horizontal or vertical ‘ Instantaneous-Field-of-View (IFOV)’ of at least 10 mrad/pixel (milliradians/pixel); 2. Incorporating a fixed focal-length lens that is not designed to be removed; 3. Not incorporating a ‘ direct view’ display; and
Technical Note: ‘ Direct view’ refers to an imaging camera operating in the infrared spectrum that presents a visual image to a human observer using a near-to-eye micro display incorporating any light-security mechanism. 4. Having any of the following: a. No facility to obtain a viewable image of the detected field-of-view; or b. The camera is designed for a single kind of application and designed not to be user modified; or
Technical Note: ‘ Instantaneous Field of View (IFOV)’ specified in Note 3.b is the lesser figure of the ‘ Horizontal FOV’ or the ‘ Vertical FOV’. ‘ Horizontal IFOV’ = horizontal Field of View (FOV)/number of horizontal detector elements ‘ Vertical IFOV’= vertical Field of View (FOV)/number of vertical detector elements. c. Where the camera is “specially designed” for installation into a civilian passenger land vehicle of less than 3 tonnes three tons (gross vehicle weight) and having all of the following: 1. Is operable only when installed in any of the following: a. The civilian passenger land vehicle for which it was intended; or b. A “specially designed”, authorized maintenance test facility; and 2. Incorporates an active mechanism that forces the camera not to function when it is removed from the vehicle for which it was intended.

breadcrumbs: 6A003 Cameras, Systems or Equipment, and “Components” Therefor, as Follows (See List of Items Controlled).

See § 743.3 of the EAR for thermal camera reporting for exports that are not authorized by an individually validated license of thermal imaging cameras controlled by ECCN 6A003.b.4.b to destinations in Country Group A:1 (see Supplement No. 1 to part 740 of the EAR), must be reported to BIS.
Imaging cameras incorporating “focal plane arrays” having any of the following:
history.text: Incorporating “focal plane arrays” controlled by 6A002.a.3.f; or

structure.heading: Incorporating “focal plane arrays” controlled by 6A002.a.3.f; or
structure.label: 6A003.b.4.b – Incorporating “focal plane arrays” controlled by 6A002.a.3.f; or

history.heading: Note 3: 6A003.b.4.b does not control imaging cameras having any of the following characteristics: a. A maximum frame rate equal to or less than 9 Hz; b. Having all of the following: 1. Having a minimum horizontal or vertical ‘ Instantaneous-Field-of-View (IFOV)’ of at least 10 mrad/pixel (milliradians/pixel); 2. Incorporating a fixed focal-length lens that is not designed to be removed; 3. Not incorporating a ‘ direct view’ display; and
history.title: Note 3: 6A003.b.4.b does not control imaging cameras having any of the following characteristics: a. A maximum frame rate equal to or less than 9 Hz; b. Having all of the following: 1. Having a minimum horizontal or vertical ‘ Instantaneous-Field-of-View (IFOV)’ of at least 10 mrad/pixel (milliradians/pixel); 2. Incorporating a fixed focal-length lens that is not designed to be removed; 3. Not incorporating a ‘ direct view’ display; and

supplement.heading: Supplement No. 6 to Part 774 - Sensitive List

history.text:
Note 3: 6A003.b.4.b does not control imaging cameras having any of the following characteristics: a. A maximum frame rate equal to or less than 9 Hz; b. Having all of the following: 1. Having a minimum horizontal or vertical ‘ Instantaneous-Field-of-View (IFOV)’ of at least 10 mrad/pixel (milliradians/pixel); 2. Incorporating a fixed focal-length lens that is not designed to be removed; 3. Not incorporating a ‘ direct view’ display; and
Technical Note: ‘ Direct view’ refers to an imaging camera operating in the infrared spectrum that presents a visual image to a human observer using a near-to-eye micro display incorporating any light-security mechanism. 4. Having any of the following: a. No facility to obtain a viewable image of the detected field-of-view; or b. The camera is designed for a single kind of application and designed not to be user modified; or
Technical Note: ‘ Instantaneous Field of View (IFOV)’ specified in Note 3.b is the lesser figure of the ‘ Horizontal FOV’ or the ‘ Vertical FOV’. ‘ Horizontal IFOV’ = horizontal Field of View (FOV)/number of horizontal detector elements ‘ Vertical IFOV’= vertical Field of View (FOV)/number of vertical detector elements. c. Where the camera is “specially designed” for installation into a civilian passenger land vehicle of less than 3 tonnes three tons (gross vehicle weight) and having all of the following: 1. Is operable only when installed in any of the following: a. The civilian passenger land vehicle for which it was intended; or b. A “specially designed”, authorized maintenance test facility; and 2. Incorporates an active mechanism that forces the camera not to function when it is removed from the vehicle for which it was intended.

structure.heading: Note 3: 6A003.b.4.b does not control imaging cameras having any of the following characteristics: a. A maximum frame rate equal to or less than 9 Hz; b. Having all of the following: 1. Having a minimum horizontal or vertical ‘ Instantaneous-Field-of-View (IFOV)’ of at least 10 mrad/pixel (milliradians/pixel); 2. Incorporating a fixed focal-length lens that is not designed to be removed; 3. Not incorporating a ‘ direct view’ display; and
structure.label: 6A003.b.4.b – Note 3: 6A003.b.4.b does not control imaging cameras having any of the following characteristics: a. A maximum frame rate equal to or less than 9 Hz; b. Having all of the following: 1. Having a minimum horizontal or vertical ‘ Instantaneous-Field-of-View (IFOV)’ of at least 10 mrad/pixel (milliradians/pixel); 2. Incorporating a fixed focal-length lens that is not designed to be removed; 3. Not incorporating a ‘ direct view’ display; and

content.html:
Technical Note:

‘ Direct view’ refers to an imaging camera operating in the infrared spectrum that presents a visual image to a human observer using a near-to-eye micro display incorporating any light-security mechanism.

4. Having any of the following:

a. No facility to obtain a viewable image of the detected field-of-view; or

b. The camera is designed for a single kind of application and designed not to be user modified; or
content.text: Technical Note: ‘ Direct view’ refers to an imaging camera operating in the infrared spectrum that presents a visual image to a human observer using a near-to-eye micro display incorporating any light-security mechanism. 4. Having any of the following: a. No facility to obtain a viewable image of the detected field-of-view; or b. The camera is designed for a single kind of application and designed not to be user modified; or

content.html:
Technical Note:

‘ Instantaneous Field of View (IFOV)’ specified in Note 3.b is the lesser figure of the ‘ Horizontal FOV’ or the ‘ Vertical FOV’.

‘ Horizontal IFOV’ = horizontal Field of View (FOV)/number of horizontal detector elements

‘ Vertical IFOV’= vertical Field of View (FOV)/number of vertical detector elements.

c. Where the camera is “specially designed” for installation into a civilian passenger land vehicle of less than 3 tonnes three tons (gross vehicle weight) and having all of the following:

1. Is operable only when installed in any of the following:

a. The civilian passenger land vehicle for which it was intended; or

b. A “specially designed”, authorized maintenance test facility; and

2. Incorporates an active mechanism that forces the camera not to function when it is removed from the vehicle for which it was intended.
content.text: Technical Note: ‘ Instantaneous Field of View (IFOV)’ specified in Note 3.b is the lesser figure of the ‘ Horizontal FOV’ or the ‘ Vertical FOV’. ‘ Horizontal IFOV’ = horizontal Field of View (FOV)/number of horizontal detector elements ‘ Vertical IFOV’= vertical Field of View (FOV)/number of vertical detector elements. c. Where the camera is “specially designed” for installation into a civilian passenger land vehicle of less than 3 tonnes three tons (gross vehicle weight) and having all of the following: 1. Is operable only when installed in any of the following: a. The civilian passenger land vehicle for which it was intended; or b. A “specially designed”, authorized maintenance test facility; and 2. Incorporates an active mechanism that forces the camera not to function when it is removed from the vehicle for which it was intended.

See § 743.3 of the EAR for thermal camera reporting for exports that are not authorized by an individually validated license of thermal imaging cameras controlled by ECCN 6A003.b.4.b to destinations in Country Group A:1 (see Supplement No. 1 to part 740 of the EAR), must be reported to BIS.
Imaging cameras incorporating “focal plane arrays” having any of the following:
history.text: Incorporating “focal plane arrays” controlled by 6A002.a.3.f; or

structure.heading: Incorporating “focal plane arrays” controlled by 6A002.a.3.f; or
structure.label: 6A003.b.4.b – Incorporating “focal plane arrays” controlled by 6A002.a.3.f; or

history.heading: Note 3: 6A003.b.4.b does not control imaging cameras having any of the following characteristics: a. A maximum frame rate equal to or less than 9 Hz; b. Having all of the following: 1. Having a minimum horizontal or vertical ‘ Instantaneous-Field-of-View (IFOV)’ of at least 10 mrad/pixel (milliradians/pixel); 2. Incorporating a fixed focal-length lens that is not designed to be removed; 3. Not incorporating a ‘ direct view’ display; and
history.title: Note 3: 6A003.b.4.b does not control imaging cameras having any of the following characteristics: a. A maximum frame rate equal to or less than 9 Hz; b. Having all of the following: 1. Having a minimum horizontal or vertical ‘ Instantaneous-Field-of-View (IFOV)’ of at least 10 mrad/pixel (milliradians/pixel); 2. Incorporating a fixed focal-length lens that is not designed to be removed; 3. Not incorporating a ‘ direct view’ display; and

supplement.heading: Supplement No. 6 to Part 774—Sensitive List

history.text:
Note 3: 6A003.b.4.b does not control imaging cameras having any of the following characteristics: a. A maximum frame rate equal to or less than 9 Hz; b. Having all of the following: 1. Having a minimum horizontal or vertical ‘ Instantaneous-Field-of-View (IFOV)’ of at least 10 mrad/pixel (milliradians/pixel); 2. Incorporating a fixed focal-length lens that is not designed to be removed; 3. Not incorporating a ‘ direct view’ display; and
Technical Note: ‘ Direct view’ refers to an imaging camera operating in the infrared spectrum that presents a visual image to a human observer using a near-to-eye micro display incorporating any light-security mechanism. 4. Having any of the following: a. No facility to obtain a viewable image of the detected field-of-view; or b. The camera is designed for a single kind of application and designed not to be user modified; or
Technical Note: ‘ Instantaneous Field of View (IFOV)’ specified in Note 3.b is the lesser figure of the ‘ Horizontal FOV’ or the ‘ Vertical FOV’. ‘ Horizontal IFOV’ = horizontal Field of View (FOV)/number of horizontal detector elements ‘ Vertical IFOV’= vertical Field of View (FOV)/number of vertical detector elements. c. Where the camera is “specially designed” for installation into a civilian passenger land vehicle of less than 3 tonnes three tons (gross vehicle weight) and having all of the following: 1. Is operable only when installed in any of the following: a. The civilian passenger land vehicle for which it was intended; or b. A “specially designed”, authorized maintenance test facility; and 2. Incorporates an active mechanism that forces the camera not to function when it is removed from the vehicle for which it was intended.

structure.heading: Note 3: 6A003.b.4.b does not control imaging cameras having any of the following characteristics: a. A maximum frame rate equal to or less than 9 Hz; b. Having all of the following: 1. Having a minimum horizontal or vertical ‘ Instantaneous-Field-of-View (IFOV)’ of at least 10 mrad/pixel (milliradians/pixel); 2. Incorporating a fixed focal-length lens that is not designed to be removed; 3. Not incorporating a ‘ direct view’ display; and
structure.label: 6A003.b.4.b – Note 3: 6A003.b.4.b does not control imaging cameras having any of the following characteristics: a. A maximum frame rate equal to or less than 9 Hz; b. Having all of the following: 1. Having a minimum horizontal or vertical ‘ Instantaneous-Field-of-View (IFOV)’ of at least 10 mrad/pixel (milliradians/pixel); 2. Incorporating a fixed focal-length lens that is not designed to be removed; 3. Not incorporating a ‘ direct view’ display; and

content.html:
Technical Note:

‘ Direct view’ refers to an imaging camera operating in the infrared spectrum that presents a visual image to a human observer using a near-to-eye micro display incorporating any light-security mechanism.

4. Having any of the following:

a. No facility to obtain a viewable image of the detected field-of-view; or

b. The camera is designed for a single kind of application and designed not to be user modified; or
content.text: Technical Note: ‘ Direct view’ refers to an imaging camera operating in the infrared spectrum that presents a visual image to a human observer using a near-to-eye micro display incorporating any light-security mechanism. 4. Having any of the following: a. No facility to obtain a viewable image of the detected field-of-view; or b. The camera is designed for a single kind of application and designed not to be user modified; or

content.html:
Technical Note:

‘ Instantaneous Field of View (IFOV)’ specified in Note 3.b is the lesser figure of the ‘ Horizontal FOV’ or the ‘ Vertical FOV’.

‘ Horizontal IFOV’ = horizontal Field of View (FOV)/number of horizontal detector elements

‘ Vertical IFOV’= vertical Field of View (FOV)/number of vertical detector elements.

c. Where the camera is “specially designed” for installation into a civilian passenger land vehicle of less than 3 tonnes three tons (gross vehicle weight) and having all of the following:

1. Is operable only when installed in any of the following:

a. The civilian passenger land vehicle for which it was intended; or

b. A “specially designed”, authorized maintenance test facility; and

2. Incorporates an active mechanism that forces the camera not to function when it is removed from the vehicle for which it was intended.
content.text: Technical Note: ‘ Instantaneous Field of View (IFOV)’ specified in Note 3.b is the lesser figure of the ‘ Horizontal FOV’ or the ‘ Vertical FOV’. ‘ Horizontal IFOV’ = horizontal Field of View (FOV)/number of horizontal detector elements ‘ Vertical IFOV’= vertical Field of View (FOV)/number of vertical detector elements. c. Where the camera is “specially designed” for installation into a civilian passenger land vehicle of less than 3 tonnes three tons (gross vehicle weight) and having all of the following: 1. Is operable only when installed in any of the following: a. The civilian passenger land vehicle for which it was intended; or b. A “specially designed”, authorized maintenance test facility; and 2. Incorporates an active mechanism that forces the camera not to function when it is removed from the vehicle for which it was intended.
